description: Sum of digits of n written in base 11.
links: Robert Walker, Self Similar Sloth Canon Number Sequences
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Digit Sum
formula: a(0)=0, then a(11n+i)=a(n)+i 0<=i<=10; a(n)=n-(m-1)*(sum(k>0, floor(n/m^k))=n-(m-1)*A064458 (n). - _Benoit Cloitre_, Dec 19 2002
example: a(20) = 1 + 9 = 10 because 20 is written as 19 base 11.
mathematica: Table[Plus @@ IntegerDigits[n, 11], {n, 0, 86}] (* or *)Nest[ Flatten[ #1 /. a_Integer -> Table[a + i, {i, 0, 10}]] &, {0}, 2] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jul 27 2006 *)
